column4: Question: Upon booting my computer, it said that a new release of namby or whatever was out, and that i should do-something-something. It installed a GB load of stuff, or so it said,and now I'm unable to do few things. I cannot launch Software-update-center, I cannot apt-get install conkeror, I cannot use my terminal emulator properly urxvt
please be more precise
some exact error messages would be a good start
okay, firstly, my error from urxvt : when I try "clear" command, it says "rxvt-256color", unknown terminal type
did not see one from you
my error #1: before startx, I can launch "irssi" no problem. AFter I startx, when I try to launch irssi, it says "rxvt-256 color: unknown terminal type"
whats the chipset, what does ifconfig show paste.ubuntu.com with ifconfig and lspci
1 sec, doing so, I will have to manually type the output so give me a minute
lspci output is very long for me to type letter by letter. Can you tell me what entry you are looking for so I can check for it
the wired chipset
ethernet controller is Realtek something something, do you want the specifics or is it another entry I am looking for?
need the exact chipset
Ethernet controller: realtex semiconductor co ltd rtl 8111/8168B prci express gigabit ethernet controller (rev01)
**realtek
**realtek
**pci
sorry, forgot to attach the ifconfig. Ifconfig for eth0 ::: link encap:ethernet hwaddr 00:1e:......
what does sudo dhclient eth0    show? ie does it get a lease or not
operation not permitted, I think I have to chattr resolv.conf , right?
what did you remove to get in that state?
as in, the permission or not having connection? All I did was dpkg-reconfigure console-setup and -reconfigure keyboard-layout

if I knew how I ended up like this, I would be much less frustrated. as a sidenote, this problem occured the same boot as I got prompted to update a couple of stuff and upgrade a couple of others. I don't think that's related though
also my /etc/network/interfaces has "lo", not "eth0". I never touched that file.
